member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Dapper.SqlMapper.Query(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Data.CommandType})
member.summary: Return a list of dynamic objects, reader is closed after the call

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Dapper.SqlMapper.Query``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Data.CommandType})
member.summary: Executes a query, returning the data typed as per T
member.remarks: the dynamic param may seem a bit odd, but this works around a major usability issue in vs, if it is Object vs completion gets annoying. Eg type new [space] get new object
member.returns: A sequence of data of the supplied type; if a basic type (int, string, etc) is queried then the data from the first column in assumed, otherwise an instance is created per row, and a direct column-name===member-name mapping is assumed (case insensitive).

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore
member.summary: Represents an error log capable of storing and retrieving errors generated in an ASP.NET Web application.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.DefaultBackupQueueSize
member.summary: The default number of exceptions (rollups count as 1) to buffer in memory in the event of an error store outage

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.DefaultRollupSeconds
member.summary: The default number of seconds to roll up errors for. Identical stack trace errors within 10 minutes get a DuplicateCount++ instead of a separate exception logged.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.AddJSInclude(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a JavaScript include to all error log pages, for customizing the behavior and such
member.param: The path of the JS file, app-relative ~/ are allowed

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.AddCSSInclude(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a CSS include to all error log pages, for customizing the look and feel
member.param: The path of the CSS file, app-relative ~/ are allowed

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.jQueryURL
member.summary: The URL to use for jQuery on the pages rendered by Exceptional

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.EnableLogging
member.summary: Re-enables error logging afer a .DisableLogging() call

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.DisableLogging
member.summary: Disables error logging, call .EnableLogging() to re-enable
member.remarks: This is useful when an app domain is being torn down, for example IRegisteredObject.Stop() when a web application is being stopped

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.#ctor(StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings)
member.summary: Base constructor of the error store to set common properties

member.summary: Creates an error store with the specified rollup

member.summary: The Rollup threshold within which errors logged rapidly are rolled up

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.LastWriteFailure

member.summary: Sets the default error store to use for logging
member.param: The application name to use when logging errors
The error store used to store, e.g. new SQLErrorStore(myConnectionString)

member.summary: Gets the count of exceptions, optionally those since a certain date

member.summary: Queues an error into the backup/retry queue

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.Test
member.summary: Tests to see if this error store is working

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.LogExceptionWithoutContext(System.Exception,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: For logging an exception with no HttpContext, most commonly used in non-web applications so that they don't have to carry a reference to System.Web
member.param: The exception to log
Whether to append a full stack trace to the exception's detail
Whether to log up per-server, e.g. errors are only duplicates if they have same stack on the same machine
Any custom data to store with the exception like UserId, etc...this will be rendered as JSON in the error view for script use

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.LogException(System.Exception,System.Web.HttpContext,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Logs an exception to the configured error store, or the in-memory default store if none is configured
member.param: The exception to log
The HTTPContext to record variables from. If this isn't a web request, pass in here
Whether to append a full stack trace to the exception's detail
Whether to log up per-server, e.g. errors are only duplicates if they have same stack on the same machine
Any custom data to store with the exception like UserId, etc...this will be rendered as JSON in the error view for script use
If specified, the application name to log with, if not specified the name in the config is used
member.returns: The Error created, if one was created and logged, null if nothing was logged
member.remarks: When dealing with a non web requests, pass in for context. It shouldn't be forgotten for most web application usages, so it's not an optional parameter.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.IsDescendentOf(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if t is of className, or descendent from className

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.IsLoggingEnabled
member.summary: Returns whether an error passed in right now would be logged

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.GetCustomData
member.summary: Method to get custom data for an error for, will be call when custom data isn't already present

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.GetIPAddress
member.summary: Method of getting the IP address for the error, defaults to retrieving it from server variables but may need to be replaced in special nulti-proxy situations.

member.name: E:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.OnBeforeLog
member.summary: Event handler to run before an exception is logged to the store

member.name: E:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.OnAfterLog
member.summary: Event handler to run after an exception has been logged to the store

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.BackupQueueSize
member.summary: The size of the backup/retry queue for logging, defaults to 1000

member.summary: Gets if this error store is

member.summary: Get the name of this error log store implementation.

member.summary: Gets the name of the application to which the log is scoped.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.MachineName
member.summary: Gets the name of the machine logging these errors.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.IgnoreRegexes
member.summary: Gets the list of exceptions to ignore specified in the configuration file

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.IgnoreExceptions
member.summary: Gets the list of exceptions to ignore specified in the configuration file

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.Default
member.summary: Gets the default error store specified in the configuration, or the in-memory store if none is configured.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.WriteQueue
member.summary: Gets the write queue for errors, which is populated in the case of a write failure

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStore.LastRetryException
member.summary: Gets the last exception that happened when trying to log exceptions

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorBeforeLogEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for the event handler called before an exception is logged

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorBeforeLogEventArgs.#ctor(StackExchange.Exceptional.Error)
member.summary: Creates an ErrorBeforeLogEventArgs object to be passed to event handlers, setting .Abort = true prevents the error from being logged.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorBeforeLogEventArgs.Abort
member.summary: Whether to abort the logging of this exception, if set to true the exception will not be logged.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorBeforeLogEventArgs.Error
member.summary: The Error object in question

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorAfterLogEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for the event handler called after an exception is logged

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorAfterLogEventArgs.#ctor(StackExchange.Exceptional.Error)
member.summary: Creates an ErrorAfterLogEventArgs object to be passed to event handlers

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorAfterLogEventArgs.GetError
member.summary: Gets the current state of the Error that was logged. Important note: since this may be a duplicate of an earlier error it's an explicit fetch from the error store
member.returns: The current state of the Error matching this guid

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorAfterLogEventArgs.ErrorGuid
member.summary: The Error object in question

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.HandlerFactory
member.summary: HTTP handler that chooses the correct handler/view based on the request.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.HandlerFactory.GetHandler(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the HttpHandler for executing the request, used to proxy requests through here (e.g. MVC) or by the HttpModule directly
member.param: The HTTPContext for the request
The type of request, GET/POST
The URL of the request
The translated path of the request
member.returns: The HTTPHandler that can execute the request

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.HandlerFactory.ReleaseHandler(System.Web.IHttpHandler)
member.summary: Enables the factory to reuse an existing handler instance.

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule
member.summary: HTTP module that catches and log exceptions from ASP.Net Applications

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule.Init(System.Web.HttpApplication)
member.summary: Initializes the module and prepares it to handle requests.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the module.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule.OnError(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: The handler called when an unhandled exception bubbles up to the module.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule.LogException(System.Exception,System.Web.HttpContext,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Logs an exception and its context to the error log.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ExceptionalModule.ErrorStore
member.summary: Gets the instance to which the module will log exceptions.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.UnknownIP
member.summary: When a client IP can't be determined

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToRelativeTimeSpan(System.DateTime)
member.summary: returns a html span element with relative time elapsed since this event occurred, eg, "3 months ago" or "yesterday"; assumes time is *already* stored in UTC format!

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToRelativeTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a humanized string indicating how long ago something happened, eg "3 days ago". For future dates, returns when this DateTime will occur from DateTime.UtcNow.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.Truncate(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: force string to be maxlen or smaller

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.TruncateWithEllipsis(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: If this String is over 'maxLength', answers a new String with Length = 'maxLength', with ... as the final three characters.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Answers true if this String is either null or empty.
member.remarks: I'm so tired of typing String.IsNullOrEmpty(s)

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.IsNullOrEmptyReturn(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Returns the first non-null/non-empty parameter when this String is null/empty.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.HasValue(System.String)
member.summary: Answers true if this String is neither null or empty.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.IsPrivateIP(System.String)
member.summary: returns true if this is a private network IP http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_network

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.GetRemoteIP(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: retrieves the IP address of the current request -- handles proxies and private networks

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string to a guid, or empty guid if empty or invalid

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToFileName(System.Guid)
member.summary: Strips non-essential characters from a guid

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToShortException(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the short exception name, e.g. System.IndexOutOfRange returns just IndexOutOfRange

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ResolvePath(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves ~\ relative paths if needed

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ResolveRelativeUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves ~/ relative paths if needed

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToEpochTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a unix Epoch time given a Date

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToEpochTime(System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns a unix Epoch time if given a value, and null otherwise.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToJsonDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.List{StackExchange.Exceptional.Error.NameValuePair})
member.summary: Takes a NameValuePair collection and reduces it down to a JSON object in kay/value pair form
member.remarks: This is not technically correct for all cases, since a querystring can contain multiple occurences of the same variable for example, this reduces it down to 1 occurence for the acessibility tradeoff

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToNameValueCollection(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Turns a dictionary into a name value collection, for code reuse

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Extensions.ExtensionMethods.ToJson(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a JSON string representing this object

member.summary: The Ignore section of the configuration, optional and no errors will be blocked from logging if not specified

member.summary: Regular expressions collection for errors to ignore. Any errors with a .ToString() matching any regex here will not be logged

member.summary: Types collection for errors to ignore. Any errors with a Type matching any name here will not be logged

member.summary: Ignore element for deserilization from a configuration, e.g. web.config or app.config

member.summary: Form submitted values to replace on save - this prevents logging passwords, etc.

member.summary: Cookie values to replace on save - this prevents logging auth tokens, etc.

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings
member.summary: A settings object describing an error store

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.Type
member.summary: The type of error store to use, File, SQL, Memory, etc.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.Path
member.summary: The path to use on file based error stores

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.ConnectionString
member.summary: The connection string to use on database based error stores. If provided, ConnectionStringName is ignored.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.ConnectionStringName
member.summary: The name of the connection string to use from the application's configuration.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.Size
member.summary: The size of this error log, either how many to keep or how many to display depending on type

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.RollupSeconds
member.summary: The duration in seconds of error groups to rollup, similar errors within this timespan will be shown as duplicates

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings.BackupQueueSize
member.summary: The size of the backup queue to use for the log, after rollups, it's how many entries in memory can be stored before culling the oldest

member.summary: The name that describes this regex

member.summary: The Pattern to match on the exception message

member.summary: Regex object representing the pattern specified, compiled once for use against all future exceptions

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.IgnoreType
member.summary: A type entry, to match against error messages types to see if we should ignore them

member.summary: The name that describes this ignored type

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.IgnoreType.Type
member.summary: The fully qualified type of the exception to ignore

member.summary: A filter entry with the forn variable name and what to replace the value with when logging

member.summary: The form parameter name to ignore

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.LogFilter.ReplaceWith
member.summary: The value to log instead of the real value

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore
member.summary: An implementation that uses JSON files as its backing store.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.MaximumSize
member.summary: The maximum count of errors stored before the first is overwritten.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.DefaultSize
member.summary: The default maximum count of errors stored before the first is overwritten.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.#ctor(StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the given configuration.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified path string.
member.param: The folder path to use to store errors
How many errors to limit the log to, the size+1th error (oldest) will be removed if exceeded
The rollup seconds, defaults to , duplicate errors within this time period will be rolled up

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.ProtectError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Protects an error from deletion, by making it ReadOnly
member.param: The guid of the error to protect
member.returns: True if the error was found and proected, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.DeleteError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Deletes an error, by deleting it from the logging folder
member.param: The guid of the error to delete
member.returns: True if the error was found and deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.DeleteAllErrors(System.String)
member.summary: Deleted all errors in the log, by clearing all *.json files in the folder
member.returns: True if any errors were deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.LogError(StackExchange.Exceptional.Error)
member.summary: Logs the JSON representation of an Error to the file store specified by the page for this store If the rollup conditions are met, then the matching error will have a DuplicateCount += @DuplicateCount (usually 1, unless in retry) rather than a distinct new row for the error
member.param: The error to log

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.GetError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the error with the specified guid from the log/folder
member.param: The guid of the error to retrieve
member.returns: The error object if found, null otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.GetAllErrors(System.Collections.Generic.List{StackExchange.Exceptional.Error},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all of the errors in the log folder

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.GetErrorCount(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a count of application errors since the specified date, or all time if null

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.TryFindOriginalError(System.String,StackExchange.Exceptional.Error@)
member.summary: Answers the older exception that 'possibleDuplicate' matches, returning null if no match is found.

member.name: P:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.JSONErrorStore.Name
member.summary: Name for this error store

member.name: T:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore
member.summary: An implementation that uses SQL Server as its backing store.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.MaximumDisplayCount
member.summary: The maximum count of errors to show.

member.name: F:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.DefaultDisplayCount
member.summary: The default maximum count of errors shown at once.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.#ctor(StackExchange.Exceptional.ErrorStoreSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the given configuration.

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified connection string.
member.param: The database connection string to use
How many errors to display in the log (for display ONLY, the log is not truncated to this value)
The rollup seconds, defaults to , duplicate errors within this time period will be rolled up

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.ProtectError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Protects an error from deletion, by making IsProtected = 1 in the database
member.param: The guid of the error to protect
member.returns: True if the error was found and protected, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.ProtectErrors(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Protects errors from deletion, by making IsProtected = 1 in the database
member.param: The guids of the error to protect
member.returns: True if the errors were found and protected, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.DeleteError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Deletes an error, by setting DeletionDate = GETUTCDATE() in SQL
member.param: The guid of the error to delete
member.returns: True if the error was found and deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.DeleteErrors(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Deletes errors, by setting DeletionDate = GETUTCDATE() in SQL
member.param: The guids of the error to delete
member.returns: True if the errors were found and deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.HardDeleteError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Hard deletes an error, actually deletes the row from SQL rather than setting DeletionDate This is used to cleanup when testing the error store when attempting to come out of retry/failover mode after losing connection to SQL
member.param: The guid of the error to hard delete
member.returns: True if the error was found and deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.DeleteAllErrors(System.String)
member.summary: Deleted all errors in the log, by setting DeletionDate = GETUTCDATE() in SQL
member.returns: True if any errors were deleted, false otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.LogError(StackExchange.Exceptional.Error)
member.summary: Logs the error to SQL If the rollup conditions are met, then the matching error will have a DuplicateCount += @DuplicateCount (usually 1, unless in retry) rather than a distinct new row for the error
member.param: The error to log

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.GetError(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the error with the specified guid from SQL This can return a deleted error as well, there's no filter based on DeletionDate
member.param: The guid of the error to retrieve
member.returns: The error object if found, null otherwise

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.GetAllErrors(System.Collections.Generic.List{StackExchange.Exceptional.Error},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all non-deleted application errors in the database

member.name: M:StackExchange.Exceptional.Stores.SQLErrorStore.GetErrorCount(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a count of application errors since the specified date, or all time if null

member.summary: Name for this error store
